Articles.Content:
I went ahead and took my turn; the Fermi retaliated with what remained of its ammunition, destroying your fighter quite spectacularly [Hooray for Kessler Syndrome!], although it is now effectively out of action for the remainder of combat, as it is relying on backup power and has depleted its armament. Likewise, I retreated the Kirchhoff to a fairly inaccessible and certainly delta-v-intensive low inclined orbit in the hopes of protecting it against attacks, and the Bohr has moved into high retrograde orbit in preparation the interception of your carrier-group [i know that the Firehole 1 is not technically a carrier, but it certainly resembles one]; the Euclid and Rutherford have remained in position, awaiting further combat before committing to a particular course of action.

Screenshots:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

Edited November 11, 2014 by Three1415

it looks like a big Drekevak....

It's just an enlarged Mk-IV Victory class with two more missiles, the armour and spine structure are virtually identical which means that the overall shape isn't much different. I'll post a pic of the ship in space this afternoon.

Here you go:

Edited November 11, 2014 by Megalodon 720

While waiting for AvronMullican to choose the battle location, I decided to increase the maximum tonnage to 200, after realizing that the combined mass of my ships was exactly 175 tons; such perfect exploitation of allowable tonnage seemed somewhat unfair. Also, I shall present my ships:

1: The C3V [read "cee-three-vee"] Kirchoff, a Diffraction Class Battlecruiser:

http://i.imgur.com/a7OgcnA.png

94.26 tons.

2: The C3V Euclid, a Vertex Class Corvette:

http://i.imgur.com/2jRzOsz.png

34.11 tons.

3: The C3V Rutherford, a Hadron Class Bomber:

http://i.imgur.com/w3ThSuE.png

22.4 tons.

and finally 4/5: Two Lepton Class Fighters, the C3V Fermi and the C3V Bohr:

http://i.imgur.com/UbAbnO0.png

http://i.imgur.com/lcANrPL.png

12.3 tons each.

Total Tonnage: 175.37 tons.

I really like your ships Three1415, they look like some sort of alien race. unlike standard fleet ships, I tried to design something similar but they were disc shaped.
It has been really quiet here... Almost too quiet...

It has been really quiet here... Almost too quiet...

I've just been really busy IRL... and I'm still working on some new ships and tech.

In the words of Gaben:

"These things, they take time."

I've been working to make this happen.

Don't need no stinkin' refuel.

Kinda been light on playing KSP though.

I've just been really busy IRL... and I'm still working on some new ships and tech.

In the words of Gaben:

"These things, they take time."

Half life 3 confirmed.

I have a new Specification for the

DREK XXX (thirty):

TONNAGE: 200-230

RANGE: 5000 M/S W/O Refuel

ARMOR: Double Layered Lifted (DLL)Ã¢â€žÂ¢

PROPULSION: At least 3 engines, in one-shot-safe areas

WEAPONS: x6 Anti-ship "Shredder" type missiles, possibly 4 Anti-Fighter Missiles.

ACCESSORIES: Crew of 1, RCS and SAS, Ion power?

Part count is expected to top 1000

Edited November 13, 2014 by zekes

I really like your ships Three1415, they look like some sort of alien race. unlike standard fleet ships, I tried to design something similar but they were disc shaped.

Thanks; that was rather what I was intending. I had grown rather tired of the more common rod-shaped vessels, and attempted to design something different. I am interested to see how yours turned out: Flying saucers would be fun to use, if merely for entertainment if not for combat.

DREK XXX (thirty):

TONNAGE: 200-230

RANGE: 5000 M/S W/O Refuel

ARMOR: Double Layered Lifted (DLL)Ã¢â€žÂ¢

PROPULSION: At least 3 engines, in one-shot-safe areas

WEAPONS: x6 Anti-ship "Shredder" type missiles, possibly 4 Anti-Fighter Missiles.

ACCESSORIES: Crew of 1, RCS and SAS, Ion power?

Part count is expected to top 1000

If you continue with your "bigger is better" trend for much longer, Zekes, you shall soon be forced to recruit Whackjob to design your vessels.

If you continue with your "bigger is better" trend for much longer, Zekes, you shall soon be forced to recruit Whackjob to design your vessels.

Well everyone else has 200 tonne battlecruisers and I've been fighting them with 120 tonne Dreks, so i think it's time to make a dedicated battleship.

Well everyone else has 200 tonne battlecruisers and I've been fighting them with 120 tonne Dreks, so i think it's time to make a dedicated battleship.

I've been using DLL in my space warships since 0.20.

Anyways, I'm going to, along with EladDv, be preoccupied with RL for quite a while.

Edited November 13, 2014 by andrew123

I just like to share my favorite ships here. what do you think

K.R.K.N. Fleet (Kraken Technologies)

Class: Battleship (former Heavy Cruiser/Battlecruiser)

Name: "Fortuna"

Model: 9

Cost: 320955.2

Part Count: 1406 parts in 3 stages

Total Mass 306.1 tons

Armament: Equipped with 4 "Frontal" shells (Standard Long I-beam variant) can be retrofitted with additional missiles and torpedoes if need be

Armor and Constuction: Double layered armor, up to three at the core module and at the front. Strut reinforced hull (It is no longer susceptible to buckling and bending at high gravity)

Powerplant and Propulsion: 4 1x6 Solar panels plus 6 hidden thermoelectric generator. 10 LV-T30 Liquid Fuel Engines, with basic fuel no RCS monopropellants

Here's My latest creation:

K.R.K.N. Fleet (Kraken Technologies)

Class: Dreadnought

Name: "Trident"

Model: 1

Cost: 285808.2

Part Count: 1547 parts in 3 stages

Total Mass 276.84 tons

Armament: Equipped with 1 "Mainsail" Rocket (Can be used for Orbital Bombardment Strikes) 6 short I-beams (Supercharged) and 6 long I-beams (Standard)

Armor and Constuction: Double to Triple layered armor, up to four at the core module. Strut reinforced hull (May be susceptible to buckling and bending at high gravity)

Powerplant and Propulsion: 3 Large Solar panels plus 6 thermoelectric generators. 1 "Skipper" and 3 "Poodle" Liquid Fuel Engines, with basic fuel no RCS monopropellants

Note: Always turn off the Monopropellant And Liquid Fuel on the Mainsail Rocket.

Guys, I gave the 'Victory' a little refit, she now has two layers of armour covering her vitals and a higher TWR, unfortunately, this means she has a lower D/V but drop tanks could be added without too much hassle.

I also made a few minor aesthetic differences.
